sentence.idiomatic: He was so nervous during the match.
She doesn't look nervous at all.
As soon as I saw him, I was so nervous I couldn't even speak.
Today he didn't perform very naturally.
Her smile is very forced.
When you are speaking, just be a little more natural and it will be fine.
She should be here soon.
He should know about this already.
I think you should consider this carefully.
He keeps staring at you, it seems like he's into you.
She is interested in you, can't you tell?
This book is really interesting.
Hurry up and leave, otherwise you won't make it in time.
He is definitely angry, otherwise he wouldn't be ignoring me.
If you like her, chase her. Otherwise you'll regret it.
You are always forgetting to bring your key.
How come you are always late recently?
This computer keeps on freezing. Is it broken?
He invited me to go see a movie with him tonight.
Lately she has a lot of guys taking her out on dinner dates.
We arranged to meet at five o'clock. He didn't get there until seven o'clock.
You're really useless. You've done very poorly on such a simple task.
Sometimes I think I'm so useless.
She always buys some useless objects to bring back with her.
``Are you free tonight? Let's have dinner."
``Are you free tonight? Let's have dinner."
Ah, don't be nervous. Act natural.
She's probably interested in me, otherwise she wouldn't always be smiling at me, and sending me text messages. I can't be mistaken.
Here she comes! Don't be nervous. Don't be nervous.
Ask her out. Say it. Say it.
Hi.
Hi.
Arg, how could I be so stupid! Totally useless!
